properties.name: HTML Results
properties.description: Placeholder used to build the HTML for ServiceNow. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Device List
properties.description: Placeholder for a list of devices fetched from FMC. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Workflow URL
properties.description: Placeholder used to build the URL of the workflow instance. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Error Message
properties.description: Placeholder for error messages. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Webex Access Token
properties.description: The access token to use to authenticate to the Webex API. Information about using a bot, which is what we recommend, can be found here: https://developer.webex.com/docs/bots

properties.name: Paging Offset
properties.description: Placeholder used to keep track of which page of results has been fetched. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Reviewed Advisories List
properties.description: Variable used to aggregate and deduplicate advisory IDs returned by the workflow. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Markdown Results
properties.description: Placeholder used to build the markdown formatted results for Webex. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Webex Room Name
properties.description: The name of the Webex room to post messages to. If using a bot, make sure to invite your bot to the room before attempting to send messages

properties.name: Keyword Search: Firepower
properties.description: If true, the workflow will search for "Firepower" advisories

properties.name: Domain UUID
properties.description: The UUID of the FMC domain to modify objects for. You can leave this as the default UUID if you only have one default domain

properties.name: Total Advisories Reviewed
properties.description: The total number of advisories from the PSIRT openVuln API retrieved by the workflow. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Total Advisories Matched
properties.description: The total number of advisories applicable to the SFMC devices returned by the workflow. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: ServiceNow User ID
properties.description: The username of the user you're using to open incident tickets. This can either match the username in your ServiceNow account key or, if the account has the appropriate permissions, can be a different user

properties.name: Device ID
properties.description: ID of the device to send the command to in SSE. This can be obtained from the device's summary page in SSE, the Devices page in the Administration section of SecureX, or by using the "SecureX - SSE Proxy - List Devices" atomic

properties.name: Keywork Search: ASA
properties.description: If true, the workflow will search for "Adaptive Security Appliance" advisories

properties.name: openVuln Search Filter
properties.description: The keywords to search the PSIRT security advisories for. This will be populated automatically

This workflow collects Cisco PSIRT Security Advisories and device details from your Secure Firewall Management Center. The workflow then checks each advisory and compares it to your Firepower devices to determine if any of your managed devices are affected by the advisory. If vulnerable devices are found, a Webex message is sent and a ServiceNow ticket is created.

Note: This workflow uses the SecureX SSE API Proxy. See the workflow documentation for more information.

Note: This workflow has been updated to support SecureX Token account keys. See the workflow documentation for more information.

Documentation: http://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0075

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: Cisco API Console, Cisco SSO, CTR_API, ServiceNow, Webex Teams

Steps: See the documentation.

actions.name: SecureX - SSE Proxy - Get FMC Details
actions.title: SecureX - SSE Proxy - Get FMC Details

properties.display_name: SecureX - SSE Proxy - Get FMC Details

properties.script:
import sys, json

deviceList = json.loads(sys.argv[1])
firewallManager = json.loads(sys.argv[2])

# Get firewall manager version.  
# ! Assumption that the first manager in the list represents all appliances if HA cluster. 
managerVersion = firewallManager['items'][0]['serverVersion'].split(" ")[0]

# Update firewall manager data 
updateManager = {'name':'Secure Firewall Management Center','hostName':'','sw_version':managerVersion, 'model':'Secure Firewall Management Center'}
secureFirewall = firewallManager['items'][0]
secureFirewall = {**secureFirewall, **updateManager}

# Update device list with firewall manager details
deviceList.append(secureFirewall)

# Convert list to string
newList = json.dumps(deviceList)

actions.title: SecureX - SSE Proxy - Get Device Details

actions.name: Execute Python Script
actions.title: Add Current Device(s) to Device List

properties.display_name: Add Current Device(s) to Device List
properties.script:
import sys, json

existingRecords = json.loads(sys.argv[1])
newRecords = json.loads(sys.argv[2])

# Append record to devices list
for record in newRecords["items"]:
   if record not in existingRecords:
      existingRecords.append(record)

# Set condition to end paging
deviceCount = int(newRecords["paging"]["count"])

# Convert list to string 
newList = json.dumps(existingRecords)

properties.display_name: Have we already reviewed this advisory?

properties.script:
import sys, json deviceList = json.loads(sys.argv[1]) productList = json.loads(sys.argv[2]) advTitle = sys.argv[3] advUrl = sys.argv[4] advId = sys.argv[5] advSev = sys.argv[6] advCveList = json.loads(sys.argv[7]) advSummary = sys.argv[8] # Set local variables webexSummary = "" serviceNowSummary = "" deviceWebexSummary = "" deviceSummary = "" deviceCount = 0 cveString = ", ".join(advCveList) # convert list to string advSummary = advSummary.replace('\n', '').replace('\\n', '') # strip newline characters from summary text # Check the software version of each device against the list of vulnerable products for device in deviceList: # Determine model type and software version string if "Threat Defense" in device['model']: modelString = "Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software " + device['sw_version'] deviceString = f"{device['name']} (FTD) `{device['hostName']}`: running software version {device['sw_version']}" if "Adaptive Security Appliance" in device['model']: modelString = "Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software " + device['sw_version'] deviceString = f"{device['name']} (ASA) `{device['hostName']}`: running software version {device['sw_version']}" if "Secure Firewall Management Center" in device['model']: deviceString = f"{device['name']} (FMC): running software version {device['sw_version']}" modelString = "Cisco Firepower Management Center " + device['sw_version'] # Search for device in affected product list for product in productList: if modelString == product: deviceWebexSummary += (f"- {deviceString}" + "\n") deviceSummary += (f"
  • {deviceString}
    • \n") deviceCount += 1 break if deviceCount >= 1: # Set Webex message webexSummary = f''' **Advisory Title:** {advTitle} **{deviceCount} device(s) impacted:** \n {deviceWebexSummary} **Advisory:** [Click here]({advUrl}) **Advisory ID:** {advId} **Severity:** {advSev} **CVE(s):** {cveString} ''' # Set Servicenow ticket message serviceNowSummary = f'''
    Advisory Title: {advTitle}
    {deviceCount} device(s) impacted:
      {deviceSummary}

    Advisory Page: Click here
    Advisory ID: {advId}
    Severity: {advSev}
    CVE(s): {cveString}
    Summary: {advSummary}
    '''
